intro: Lomaria rinconii, commonly known as the Rincón lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Lomaria rinconii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
